text:
are real to me and I still don’t see a response. I am frustrated that we can’t work together after our last discussion. I sincerely hoped we would
make peace.
On 12/28/2024 at 03:44 PM, Christine Moyer wrote:
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/28/2024 at 03:45 PM)
Subject:Re: AD is asleep
Not sure why there was a 40 min delay.
Adrian was aware of today’s visit.
You stated you would refrain from making jabs at me. They have continued.
On 12/28/2024 at 11:05 AM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/28/2024 at 03:32 PM)
Subject:Re: AD is asleep
Attachments:IMG_6961.PNG (300 KB)
This helps with context as it’s been something I’ve tried to work with you on for quite a while. Thanks!
On 12/28/2024 at 10:48 AM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: Never)
Subject:Re: AD is asleep
Christine,
I agree that professional guidance on addressing these situations is valuable. But I also note that your response feels threatening and almost like
retaliation for raising several specific concerns about Adrian's well-being and our co-parenting communication. I asked you about:
• Today's 40-minute delay which impacts my limited time with Adrian and has significant financial implications at $1k a day.
• The portrayal to Adrian that I "won't reply" about visits misrepresents my efforts and damages my relationship with him.
• Emergency communication protocols are a standard safety consideration, and you allow for no way to accommodate them.
• The concerning shift in Adrian's view of MIT from pride to mockery between visits suggests harmful negative influences on him.
Please maintain our message thread rather than forking and creating new ones. Forking threads can misrepresent the context and chronology of
our communication, which has happened a lot since this began. I don't think that is helpful to either of us when seeking helpful advice.
Looking forward to understanding a healthier way to address the points above, as they were not addressed in a constructive way.
robert
On 12/28/2024 at 09:45 AM, Christine Moyer wrote:
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/28/2024 at 09:49 AM)
Subject:Re: AD is asleep
I’ll  send this to Cimberleigh. She asked I share these types of comms.
